bio:treatment.description: Trophophore stalk sessile or nearly so; blade shiny green, ovate-deltate, 1--2-pinnate, to 6 cm, fleshy. Pinnae to 6 pairs, ascending, mostly overlapping, distance between 1st and 2d pinnae only slightly greater than between 2d and 3d pairs, basal pinna pair usually considerably larger than adjacent pair, obliquely rhomboidal to oblanceolate-spatulate, mostly shallowly lobed to rarely pinnate, margins entire to very narrowly shallowly crenulate, apex pointed, venation pinnate only at bases of proximal pinnae, otherwise Â± like ribs of fan. Sporophores 1--2-pinnate, 1--1.5 times length of trophophore.
Leaves appearing in July and August.
bio:treatment.discussion: This well-marked northern Eurasian species is best known in Scandinavia, where it occurs most commonly with Botrychium lunaria , with which it occasionally hybridizes.
